attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This is in reference to the recent case of Abu Qatada, he is wanted on terrorism charges in Algeria, the United States, Belgium, Spain, France, Germany, Italy and his native Jordan.

He now receives around £1000 per month in state benefits even though Qatada was once found to have £170,000 in cash in his possession when he was stopped by police, therefore Making a mockery of the governments promise to crack down on terror suspects. As quoted from the Telegraph. One of the governments main priorities is of course national Security and Public Safety, this decision has not been made with our country's safety and the people's wellbeing in mind. 

We are calling for the government to act on their promise of clamping down on terrorists and terrorism and not to allow such incredible misjudgements in regards to public safety.
